file_content.text: Wait, please! I'm an unarmed civilian: Representative Ecklin, with the Makeb Provisional Authority Council.
I'm the official liaison to the Hutt Cartel. Whatever you need, I'll make sure you get it. Just don't hurt me.
I won't hurt you--I'm a Jedi. I'm here to free Makeb from the Hutt Cartel's occupation.
No need to bargain.
You've been talking to Shalim and Chief Hurkwill. We don't need to be free. We need to survive.
I know who you are, Representative Ecklin. Chief Hurkwill said you were a friend.
Don't worry, you're safe.
Then... you're here on Shalim's orders. I'm sorry he brought the Jedi into this.
I'm Republic Special Forces--Havoc Squad. Shalim Avesta sent me.
Relax, I'm a friend.
That madman's gotten the Republic Army involved? Is he trying to start a war?
Relax, I'm not some trigger-happy burglar. I'm with the Republic--and Shalim Avesta.
Take it easy, pal.
Oh, for the love of.... Please tell me Shalim hasn't dragged the Republic into this nonsense.
I'm working with Shalim Avesta. He sent me to get information on the Hutt Cartel's plans.
I want answers.
And he thought the best way to do it was to attack their embassy? Typical.
I ought to take your head back to Shalim as a present. You sold out to the Hutts, didn't you?
You spineless traitor.
I am working with them. Shalim doesn't understand the situation.
Like it or not, the Hutts control Makeb now. Our only option is to cooperate--make the best of our new situation.
Instead, Shalim stirs up trouble. He doesn't realize how much worse the Hutts could make things for us.
Your emotions are blinding you to the truth. The Hutts are drilling into Makeb's core. They've destabilized the entire planet.
Calm down. Listen to reason.
Now you're the emotional one. A few groundquakes, and suddenly it's the end of the world?
No matter what you offer, the Hutts will always take more. Their deep-core drilling has destabilized the entire planet.
Appeasement is not an option.
Please, don't be drawn in by Shalim's wild speculation. There's no evidence to support it.
The Hutts are bullies. Push them down, and they'll back off. If not, they'll keep drilling into Makeb until the planet cracks in half.
Fighting is the only way.
"Cracks in half"? Is that a technical term?
If you think the Hutts respect you for rolling over, guess again. While you negotiate, the Cartel's mining right through Makeb's core.
Let me tell you about Hutts.
The only reason we're alive to debate that insane rumor is because of my negotiations.
The Hutts aren't here to rule Makeb. They're here to destroy it. Their deep drilling has destabilized the planetary core.
The planet is falling apart!
Why would they do that? Makeb is an investment for them. If they destroy the planet, they lose their assets.
Besides, most of the Hutts are here on the surface. If the planet explodes, they go with it. It's illogical.
While you're busy sucking up to the Hutts, they're destabilizing the entire planet with deep-core drilling. Makeb is falling apart, thanks to you!
You're a complete idiot.
That's exactly the kind of ridiculousness I'm talking about. Is that what Shalim tells his recruits?
It doesn't even make sense. The Hutts are here on the planet, too. If Makeb is destroyed, they die with it.
Geological readings show this planet is coming apart. But we think the Hutts have a "Project Failsafe" to deal with the situation.
We have proof.
Knowing Shalim, he'll risk anything to find it. Well, I'll save some lives and help quash this rumor for good.
The Hutts have something called "Project Failsafe," but they'll push this planet to the brink of destruction before using it.
You underestimate Hutt greed.
Say I believed you. Wouldn't I want definite proof before risking my life to stop them?
Listen closely: The planet is breaking apart, but the Hutts have a "Project Failsafe." You're going to help me find it. Understand?
Stop wasting my time!
You make a compelling and persuasive argument.
If this "Project Failsafe" exists, there must be some record of it in the embassy's archives. I'll get you access to them.
But the Hutts are on high alert. They've already summoned reinforcements. You'll have to deal with them. I'll meet you in the archive room.
Just do your part, and leave the guards to me. I don't want you getting hurt.
Stay out of sight.
The guards won't target me. That's why I prefer to travel separately.
You're taking a great risk. You must care deeply about Makeb.
Thank you for helping.
I do. Enough to know when to fight and when to cooperate.
The guards aren't a problem for me. But you won't stand a chance if they catch you.
Watch yourself in here.
I've worked at this embassy for years. I know my way around.
I was hoping you'd say there's a secret passage that'll take us right where we need to go.
Nothing's ever easy, is it?
Any passage wide enough for the Hutts wouldn't be very secret.
You're a Hutt conspirator. I'm not letting you out of my sight.
No way. You stay with me.
You're marked for death. I'm not. If I die because I'm standing next to you when the shooting starts, you can't access the archives.
And if Shalim's right, Makeb will be truly doomed. I don't think you want that on your conscience.
You worry about those reinforcements. I'll make sure we can access the Hutt archives. Good luck.
Betray us, and you're dead.
Don't even think about running back to the Hutts. There's no place in this galaxy where I can't get you.
Remember who I am. If you warn the Hutts, I will find you. No one can hide from the Force.
You saw what I did to these mercenaries. Warn the Hutts, and I'll do the same to you.
I've got contacts and informants in every corner of the galaxy. Double-cross me, and I'll hunt you down.
I'm not like Shalim. I don't fight losing battles. See you at the archives.
